excerpt: Built in 1608, revolutionary leader Simon Bolivar's final home features a museum & botanical garden.
detail_description: Quinta de San Pedro Alejandrino, built in 1608, served as the final home of revolutionary leader Simon Bolivar. The estate features a museum and botanical garden that provide a glimpse into Colombia's culture before and after the Wars of Independence. Visitors can take an informative tour through the house where Bolivar spent his last days, including viewing the bed where he passed away. The beautiful gardens are home to numerous iguanas, making for a unique experience while exploring the grounds.
name: Quinta de San Pedro Alejandrino
address: Sector San Pedro Alejandrino, Av. El Libertador, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Santa Marta is a city on the Caribbean Sea in the northern Colombian department of Magdalena. A busy port, it was also the first Spanish settlement in Colombia. It's the gateway for trips into the Tayrona National Natural Park, and for multiday guided treks to the Lost City (Teyuna) archaeological site in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta mountains.
detail_description: Santa Marta, located on the Caribbean Sea in Colombia, is a historic city and a bustling port. It serves as a gateway to Tayrona National Natural Park and guided treks to the Lost City archaeological site in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta mountains. The city offers a warm climate during Christmas and New Year's Eve, creating an extraordinary festive experience with traditional celebrations and beautiful natural surroundings.
name: Santa Marta
address: Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Urban retreat with stately monuments & park benches, surrounded by a lively restaurant/bar scene.
detail_description: Parque de los Novios, located in the Historic Center of Santa Marta, is a vibrant urban oasis surrounded by stately monuments and park benches. As the sun sets, the park comes alive with street lights and Christmas decorations, creating a festive atmosphere that invites both locals and tourists to experience the holiday spirit. The park is known for its lively restaurant and bar scene, offering a variety of dining options with terraces, hotels, vendors, and street artists.
name: Parque de los Novios
address: Cl. 20, Centro Histórico,, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Playa El Rodadero Santa Marta is a must-visit destination with its rich history and stunning natural landscapes. You can explore the city's historical sites on a guided driving tour, including the resort area of Rodadero, museums, and iconic landmarks like the Cathedral Basilica Menor de Santa Marta and the Tayrona Gold Museum. The tour concludes at Tangaga lookout for breathtaking views of the city.
name: Playa El Rodadero santa marta
address: Cra. 1 #9-23, Gaira, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Ciudad Perdida, also known as the Lost City, is an ancient archaeological site nestled deep in the Sierra Nevada mountains near Santa Marta. Accessible only by a challenging 4-5 day trek through lush jungles and steep terrain, this journey offers breathtaking scenery and encounters with indigenous communities. The experience provides insight into Colombia's history and culture while allowing hikers to swim in rivers and appreciate the diverse flora and fauna.
name: Ciudad Perdida
address: Centro Histórico, Cl. 21 #4 - 3, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Catholic church with a bell tower & an interior lined with religious paintings & statues.
detail_description: The Catedral Basílica de Santa Marta, also known as the Cathedral Basilica Menor de Santa Marta, is a Catholic church with a bell tower and an interior adorned with religious paintings and statues. Built in the 18th century and consecrated in the early 19th century, it holds historical significance as the resting place of Simon Bolivar's heart and entrails, as well as the ashes of Rodrigo de Bastidas, the city's founder.
name: Catedral Basílica de Santa Marta
address: Plaza de La Catedral, Cra. 4, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Free, bilingual museum with 4 galleries & tours featuring the life & artifacts of indigenous people.
detail_description: Museo del Oro Tairona - Casa de la Aduana is a free, bilingual museum located in the historical center of Santa Marta. Housed in the beautiful Casa de la Aduana building, it features four galleries showcasing the life and artifacts of the indigenous people of Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.
name: Museo del Oro Tayrona - Casa de la Aduana
address: Parque Simón Bolívar Carrera 2 con #Calle 14, Cra. 1, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Ciudad Perdida Teyuna, also known as the Lost City Trek, is a challenging yet rewarding adventure in Santa Marta. This ancient Inca ruin, older than Machu Picchu and nestled high in the Sierra Nevada mountains, requires at least four days of hiking through the jungle. The trek offers well-organized infrastructure with comfortable camps and quality food supplies.
name: Ciudad Perdida Teyuna - Lost City Trek Colombia
address: Cra. 1c #18-23, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: The Lost City Trek in Colombia is an incredible experience that takes you on a journey through the jungle to the ancient ruins of Ciudad Perdida-Teyuna. The trek starts from Santa Marta, serving as a gateway to various attractions like Tayrona National Park and the mountain village Minca. The multi-day trek requires good physical fitness and preparation, but it offers a chance to disconnect from modern amenities and immerse yourself in nature.
name: Lost City Trek Colombia
address: Cl. 21 #4 - 9, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Large traditional market with produce, meat & fish, plus street food in a high-energy atmosphere.
detail_description: The Mercado Público de Santa Marta is a bustling traditional market with over 500 vendors offering a wide variety of goods. From fresh produce, meat, and fish to indigenous handicrafts and souvenirs, this vibrant market has it all. Visitors can also indulge in the local street food scene, with stalls selling everything from ceviche to empanadas.
name: Mercado Público de Santa Marta
address: Cra. 9, Comuna 3, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Ikaro Cafe in Santa Marta is a popular spot for travelers and digital nomads looking for a relaxed environment to enjoy great coffee and delicious vegetarian and vegan dishes. The cafe offers organic specialty coffee from their own coffee farm, along with a menu featuring Asian Fusion cuisine. Visitors can savor healthy breakfast options, fresh fruit juices, salads, sandwiches, and gluten-free pastries. With locally sourced ingredients, the food is both fresh and nutritious.
name: Ikaro Cafe
address: Cl. 19 #3-60, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Santa Marta's historical center, Lulo Café Bar is a charming restaurant offering a diverse menu that showcases Latin American flavors. From artisanal arepas to ceviches and sliders, this spot provides an oasis of local culinary delights. The relaxed atmosphere and outdoor seating make it an ideal place to savor organic coffee or craft beer while immersing yourself in the vibrant ambiance of Santa Marta.
name: Lulo Café Bar
address: Cra. 3 #16-34, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Bright dorms & private rooms in a lively hostel with a rooftop terrace, a bar & an outdoor pool.
detail_description: La Brisa Loca is a vibrant hostel and bar in Santa Marta, offering bright dorms and private rooms for a comfortable stay. The hostel features a rooftop terrace with stunning views, where guests can relax during the day and enjoy lively parties at night. With two party environments and two DJs playing different music simultaneously, it's a popular spot for locals and foreigners alike.
name: La Brisa Loca
address: Cl. 14 #3-58, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

name: Pescadería Arrecifes STM
address: Cra. 12 #11A-04, Comuna 4, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Cañaveral is a picturesque destination nestled in the heart of Santa Marta's lush natural surroundings. This charming spot offers beautiful beaches and a camping area, making it an ideal retreat for nature enthusiasts. With its serene ambiance and stunning coastal views, Cañaveral promises a tranquil escape for those seeking to immerse themselves in the region's scenic beauty. Whether you're looking to relax on the sandy shores or explore the diverse flora and fauna, this coastal gem has something for every traveler.
name: Cañaveral
address: Comuna 1, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Indoor-outdoor aquarium with interactive swimming pools, shark feeding & educational exhibits.
detail_description: Acuario Mundo Marino is a captivating indoor-outdoor aquarium that offers interactive swimming pools, shark feeding experiences, and educational exhibits. With over 2,000 species of marine life, visitors can embark on a guided tour for a nominal fee to learn about the diverse array of creatures housed within the facility. The outdoor exhibition allows guests to interact with turtles, rays, and even observe sharks. Additionally, there are opportunities to feed toothed mammals in the afternoon at 4 pm.
name: Acuario Mundo Marino
address: Entre Calle 11A y Calle 10 Carrera 2 # 11 -68, El Rodadero, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Restaurante LamArt in Santa Marta, Colombia is a must-visit spot known for its artistic gastronomy and captivating decor. Located on the picturesque Callejon del Correo, this restaurant offers a unique dining experience where art and food come together. The menu features dishes like chicharron ceviche and boronia salmon that promise to delight both the palate and the spirit. With live music adding to the ambiance, LamArt ensures a memorable culinary journey.
name: Restaurante LamArt
address: Cra. 3 #16-30, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Crab's Bar in Santa Marta is a unique and vibrant drinking spot with an incredible decor that includes bath tubs as chairs, autographed rock star memorabilia, costumes, and even a secret terrace. The owner is a well-known public figure in the city area and engages patrons in interesting conversations filled with musical culture. This dive bar offers a laid-back atmosphere where locals gather to enjoy rock music and play pool or other table games.
name: Crab's Bar
address: Centro Histórico, Cl. 18 #3-69, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Quirky rooms & suites in an informal hotel featuring a cool bar, a rooftop terrace & outdoor pools.
detail_description: The Casa de Isabella Kali Hotel is a funky, informal hotel located near Santa Marta's Marina. The rooms come with iPod docking stations and free Wi-Fi, and there's a rooftop pool with sun loungers.
name: Casa de Isabella
address: Cra. 2 #19-20, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Bahía de Santa Marta is a popular hangout spot located by the beach, offering stunning views of the ocean and a relaxed atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy water sports, local stalls, and delicious snacks while soaking up the chill vibes of the sand and waves. The area is also known for its beautiful sunset views and peaceful ambiance, with nearby bars and restaurants for those looking to unwind.
name: Bahía de Santa Marta
address: Cra. 1c #20-134 #20- a, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: The Malecón de Bastidas in Santa Marta, also known as the Bastidas promenade, is a must-visit spot in the city center. Named after Rodrigo de Bastidas, the founder of Santa Marta, this recently renovated waterfront promenade is an important historical site and a bustling hub of activity. The area features modern stalls for artisans and upcoming dining establishments.
name: Malecón de Bastidas - Santa Marta
address: Cra. 1c #15-2, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Grand Marina Santa Marta is a centrally located aparthotel in Santa Marta, offering luxury apartments with full kitchens and balconies overlooking the marina. The hotel provides an ideal base for exploring the city, with easy access to Marina Santa Marta, Santa Marta Beach, and other attractions like Parque de Los Novios and Santa Marta Cathedral. Guests can enjoy recreational amenities such as an outdoor pool and a sauna, as well as relaxing spa treatments.
name: Grand Marina Santa Marta
address: Cl. 23 #1c-79, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Wiwa Tour Travel Agency in Santa Marta offers an unforgettable experience for travelers looking to explore the indigenous ethnic groups and natural wonders of the area. With a focus on responsible tourism, Wiwa Tour provides guided hikes to Ciudad Perdida, ensuring that visitors have a deep understanding of the region's history and traditions. The agency's knowledgeable guides, translators, and cooks go above and beyond to make sure that every traveler feels comfortable and well-informed throughout their journey.
name: Wiwa Tours Tour Agency Office
address: Cl. 16 #4 - 71 Segundo Piso, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Mirador Taganga is a popular club nestled in the mountains, offering a unique experience of dancing to diverse music genres while soaking in breathtaking views. The stunning panoramas of the bay and mountains are truly awe-inspiring, making it a must-visit despite the touristy atmosphere of the town. It's an ideal spot for capturing picturesque moments and finding souvenirs, with particularly enchanting vistas at sunset.
name: Mirador Taganga
address: Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Sierra Nevada boasts an enviable climate that attracts visitors year-round.
name: Sierra nevada
address: 470003 Calle 2, Cra. 12 #33, Los laureles, Bonda, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

name: Lost City Trek Ciudad Teyuna
address: Feria Artesanal JM, Cra. 3 #7-70, El Rodadero, Gaira, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Compact public park featuring a monument to Simón Bolívar, with landscaped gardens & ocean views.
detail_description: Parque Bolívar, also known as Plaza de Bolívar, is a charming public park located in the heart of Santa Marta. This historic square holds great significance as one of the oldest in Colombia and features a monument dedicated to Simón Bolívar. Surrounded by architectural gems, including the iconic La Casa de la Aduana and the Tayrona Gold Museum, this area offers a glimpse into the city's rich history.
name: Parque Bolívar
address: Cra. 1, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Energetic ocean cove offering calm waters for snorkeling, boats, eateries & cliffside trails.
detail_description: Playa Grande in Taganga is an energetic ocean cove with calm waters, perfect for snorkeling and boat rides. It's a great alternative to the crowded waterfront beach in Taganga. To avoid crowds, it's best to arrive early in the morning as it gets busier later on. The beach offers clear water and a sandy bottom, with space to leave belongings without needing to rent chairs.
name: Playa Grande, Taganga
address: Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Colossal bronze sculpture portraying iconic Colombian former footballer Carlos "El Pibe" Valderrama.
detail_description: The Monumento a El Pibe Valderrama is a colossal bronze sculpture that pays tribute to the legendary Colombian footballer Carlos "El Pibe" Valderrama. The statue, located in front of the Union football stadium, captures his iconic golden curls with remarkable accuracy. Visitors can take photos with the monument and enjoy its significance as a tribute to one of Colombia's most iconic soccer players. Additionally, the area offers other attractions such as a public Olympic-sized swimming pool and friendly locals.
name: Monumento a El Pibe Valderrama
address: Cra. 18 #16-54, Comuna 4, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

name: Paseo Bastidas
address: Cl. 16 #1C-72, Centro Historico, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

name: Neguanje
address: Parque Nacional Natural Tayrona,, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

name: Playa Salguero
address: Cl. 26 #1-1, Gaira, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

name: Reserva Natural Mamancana
address: Km 5 Vía al Puerto, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

name: Playa Bello Horizonte
address: Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

name: Monumento al Cacique Tayrona
address: Cra. 9 #94, Mercado, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

name: Playa cabo tortuga
address: El Rodadero, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Iglesia San Jeronimo de Mamatoco is a historic church in Santa Marta, dating back to the 16th century. It was the first church in Mamatoco and holds significance as it was burned down in 1575 by an indigenous chief in response to violence against natives. The church has a beautiful interior design and hosts Eucharist services throughout the week.
name: Iglesia de Mamatoco
address: Cl. 35 #607, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: The Casa Buena Cultura (CBC) is a vibrant cultural center in Santa Marta that offers an exceptional platform for live music performances. With its impressive stage, this space attracts and showcases local, national, and international talent, making it a hub of diverse musical experiences. The center's commitment to the Samaria community is evident through its beautiful murals and active engagement in promoting authentic culture.
name: CBC - Casa Buena Cultura
address: Cl. 14 #7 40, Comuna 2, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Playa Lipe is a tranquil beach with beautiful sea views and the option to rent tents for the afternoon. While the water may not be very clear and the sand not very soft, it offers a serene environment for relaxation. Despite some garbage from the city reaching the Manzanares River, the rest of the beach is stunning with its surroundings, water, and sand. Currently undergoing conditioning work, this beach boasts white sand and easy accessibility from Rodadero and Santa Marta.
name: Playa Lipe
address: Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

excerpt: Sea aquarium & maritime museum featuring shark, turtle & fish exhibits, plus dolphin shows.
name: Acuario Rodadero Santa Marta
address: Edf. Fuentemar Cra 1 No. 7, 69 Ed, Gaira, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

name: Reserva Natural El Dorado
address: Sierra Nevada de, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: The Loma Nevada Minca Hotel is a truly remarkable establishment that offers unparalleled experiences. It exudes excellence in every aspect, from its outstanding customer service to its immaculate and hygienic accommodations. The picturesque vistas that surround the hotel are awe-inspiring and leave guests speechless. It is an ideal destination for those seeking a rejuvenating getaway, as it provides an extraordinary location, impeccable service, and delectable cuisine.
name: Loma Nevada Minca Hotel
address: Finca La Victoria, Sta. Marta - Cerro Kenedy, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Playa Gairaca is a serene beach located at the far end of Tayrona Park in Santa Marta. It offers a quieter atmosphere with beautiful scenery and a rough sea that becomes deep quickly. While the beach is isolated and lacks services, visitors can still enjoy the stunning views and bring their own supplies for a day of relaxation. There are also options to rent sun shelters and access a restaurant for meals and drinks.
name: Playa Gairaca
address: Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

name: Casino Arhuaco
address: Cra. 2 #6-49, El Rodadero, Gaira, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia

detail_description: Casa Quinta Artesanal is a historic site featuring the Casa Quinta, where Simon Bolivar lived and died, as well as the original labor area. The rural colonial architecture and surrounding old trees create a picturesque setting for this house museum. Additionally, it houses a store offering high-quality locally made gifts such as purses, bags, bracelets, rugs, and hammocks. It's an excellent place to find luxury crafts and unique items for yourself or loved ones.
name: Casa Quinta Artesanal
address: Cra. 5 #24-03, Comuna 2, Prado, Santa Marta, Magdalena, Colombia
